name: Sun
facts: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun.
It is named after the Roman messenger god Mercury.
body_paragraph: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the one closest to the Sun, with an orbital period of about 88 Earth days. Seen from Earth, it appears to move around its orbit in about 116 days.

name: Venus
facts: Venus is the hottest planet in our Solar System.
It is often called Earth's sister planet due to their similar size and composition.
body_paragraph: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and the hottest in our Solar System, with surface temperatures exceeding 880°F (471°C). It is named after the Roman goddess of love and beauty.

name: Earth
facts: Neptune is the eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun in the Solar System.
It is named after the Roman god of the sea.
body_paragraph: Neptune is the fourth-largest planet by diameter and the third-largest by mass. It is a gas giant composed primarily of hydrogen and helium.
